content.question: The first derivative of the function g is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>π</mi> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4428@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for -0.5 < x < 1.5. On which of the following intervals is g decreasing?

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
